bioghist.p: The Sperton Philanthropic Society was formed in 1797 "to encourage learning in general as far as their influence might extend but more especially in the upper part of their own state" of South Carolina.

scopecontent.p: This is a manuscript document authorizing James Templeton, a member of the Sperton Philanthropic Society, to collect donations on behalf of the Society and for the use of "the Seminary under the care of the Society." The document is dated 1801 and signed by Thomas Patton, Chairman and William Williamson, Clerk.
